1.text: On my bed at night I sought the one I love; I sought him, but did not find him.

2.text: I will arise now and go about the city, through the streets and squares. I will seek the one I love. So I sought him but did not find him.

3.text: I encountered the watchmen on their rounds of the city: “Have you seen the one I love?”

4.text: I had just passed them when I found the one I love. I held him and would not let go until I had brought him to my mother’s house, to the chamber of the one who conceived me.

5.text: O daughters of Jerusalem, I adjure you by the gazelles and does of the field: Do not arouse or awaken love until the time is right.

6.text: Who is this coming up from the wilderness like a column of smoke, scented with myrrh and frankincense from all the spices of the merchant?

7.text: Behold, it is Solomon’s carriage, escorted by sixty of the mightiest men of Israel.

8.text: All are skilled with the sword, experienced in warfare. Each has his sword at his side prepared for the terror of the night.

9.text: King Solomon has made his carriage out of the timber of Lebanon.

10.text: He has made its posts of silver, its base of gold, its seat of purple fabric. Its interior is inlaid with love by the daughters of Jerusalem.

11.text: Come out, O daughters of Zion, and gaze at King Solomon, wearing the crown with which his mother crowned him on the day of his wedding—the day of his heart’s rejoicing.
